title: Nothing Design Co. Headquarters / Range Design & Architecture
description: This expansion of an existing structure into a furniture design studio and showroom aims to unify and express a variety of spatial qualities—to make and house furniture, address daylighting and energy performance considerations for a south-facing facade, and build upon Chicago's historical pattern of common brick structures with face-brick fronts.
author: Andreas Luco

title: Glass Bar | CASACOR Minas 2024 / Balsa Arquitetura
description: Reflecting the concept of CASACOR Minas 2024, the project is based on respect and preservation of the features, pigments, and layers that already existed in the property. On this solid foundation, elements essential for the operation of the bar were added. Functionally, an inviting and comfortable environment was created. The project values the contrast between the old and the new, between textures and materials, and explores opacities, reflections, and transparencies.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: 19-Foot-High Wooden Bookshelves And A DJ Booth For A New Streetwear Store
description: Design studio El Departamento, has shared photos of ‘Nude Library’, Nude Project’s new flagship store at La Roca Village in Barcelona, Spain. title: A New Restaurant Design Inspired By The Food It Sells – The Waffle
description: Multidisciplinary design studio Masquespacio has shared photos of their latest project, Novu Waffle, an innovative gastronomic space in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. With a focus on fun and immersion, Masquespacio has created a dynamic and cheerful environment where the waffle is the undisputed star. Waffles inspired the design of the restaurant, which can be seen on […]
author: Erin

title: BarlisWedlick opens renovated Hamptons house to the shoreline
description: New York-based studio BarlisWedlick has renovated and expanded a Southampton house to create multigenerational living spaces that open up to the seaside. The house, which was originally constructed in the 1980s, overlooks Peconic Bay in New York. BarlisWedlick took on the challenge of updating the structure, preserving the materials for carbon sequestration, and reconnecting the The post BarlisWedlick opens renovated Hamptons house to the shoreline appeared first on Dezeen.

title: "As architectural drama The Brutalist does not wholly convince"
description: The Brutalist leads the Oscar nominations but as a film about architecture it's a little underwhelming, writes Will Wiles. You wait ages for an architectural epic and then two come along (almost) at once.
